                    ### Question
                    Which of the following antitussive can lead to hallucinations

                    ### Options
                    opa. Morphine
opb. Dextromethorphan

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Dextromethorphan, an antitussive that acts on the central nervous system, can cause dissociative effects including possible hallucinations, aligning with its known side effects at high doses. Diphenhydramine, with anticholinergic properties, can also lead to confusion and hallucinations, particularly in high doses, due to its ability to cross the blood-brain barrier. Morphine, primarily an opioid receptor agonist, is associated with euphoria and pain relief, and hallucinations are not commonly reported with its use. Aprepitant, functioning as a substance P/neurokinin 1 receptor antagonist, is used to prevent chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting, with no known side effects of hallucinations. The evidence paths confirm the classifications and primary effects of these drugs but do not directly address the occurrence of hallucinations.
